poem:
The Source Code  

In dreams of wires,  
a boy spins silken thoughts,  
soft diodes hum  
under pinball lights—  
curious code unwinds.  
The spark, unseen,  
aspires, ascends,  
finding shape in silicon,  
echoes worlds,  
unfolds unseen threads,  
on circuit boards,  
he builds grand bridges  
from whispers of electrons  
into tomorrow's  
vastness.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Source Code by Bill Gates review – growing pains of a computer geek The enduring mystery about William Henry Gates III is this: how did a precocious and sometimes obnoxious kid evolve into a billionaire tech lord and then into an elder statesman and philanthropist? This book gives us only the first part of the story, tracing Gates’s evolution from birth in 1955 to the founding of Microsoft in 1975. For the next part of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
